meanings.definition: A tool with a long handle and a bundle of absorbent material used for cleaning floors.
meanings.sent1: She used the mop to clean the spilled juice on the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent2: The janitor always carries a mop to keep the school hallway clean.
meanings.sent3: The mop danced across the floor as she swirled it around.
meanings.sent4: Her mop of hair was so absorbent, it seemed to soak up all the rain.
meanings.sent5: The mop slurped up the water like a thirsty sponge.

meanings.definition: To clean or wipe with a mop.
meanings.sent1: He will mop the kitchen floor after breakfast.
meanings.sent2: She mopped the spilled milk with a cloth.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to help mop the floor with its tail wagging.
meanings.sent4: She mopped away her tears with a tissue.
meanings.sent5: The rain mopped the streets clean, leaving a fresh scent.

meanings.definition: A mass of tangled hair or wool.
meanings.sent1: Her mop of curls bounced as she ran.
meanings.sent2: The sheep's wool had formed a thick mop on its back.
meanings.sent3: The mop of yarn spilled out of the basket in a colorful mess.
meanings.sent4: The mop of seaweed washed ashore after the storm.
meanings.sent5: The mop of hair on the doll was styled in a cute braid.
